item.description:
Stratton Brook State Park was originally a part of Massacoe State Forest.   It was established along the tracks of the Unionville and Collinsville branch of the Farmington Valley rail line.   The purpose was to experiment with methods of putting out fires from cinders blowing from the steam engines.   This caused a lot of property loss in the railroad days.   Now the rail line is a rail trail, and the park has some other trails as well.

 

This will be an easy walk of about 3 miles with little difficulty.   Social walking pace.   We will be out for 2 hours or as fate may have it.   The walk will be rescheduled if there is a threat of rain.

 

Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

 

Location:   [approximate address, no mailbox there, GPS not guaranteed to lead you there] 149 Farms Village Rd, route 309, Simsbury, CT.

[Link to maps.google.com, www.mapquest.com, or maps.yahoo.com]
